question: 騒ぐ
sourceAnswer: to: make-noise/make-racket/be-noisy | rustle/swoosh | make-merry | clamor/clamour/make-a-fuss/kick-up-a-fuss | lose-one's-cool/panic/act-flustered | feel-tense/be-uneasy/be-excited
sourceMnemonic: The kanji is <kanji>boisterous</kanji>. The verb version is <vocabulary>to make noise</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be boisterous</vocabulary>. Basically, you're being boisterous when you make a lot of noise, so that's where it comes from.
sourceReadingMnemonic: When you go <vocabulary>to make noise</vocabulary> and be boisterous, you go to the local <ja>沢</ja> (<ja><reading>さわ</reading></ja>) swamp. It's an awesome place, and people don't complain about the noise.
